es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel
Class TimeDrivenActivity

java.lang.Object
  es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.SimulationObject
      es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.VariableStoreSimulationObject
          es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.TimeStampedSimulationObject
              es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.Activity
                  es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.TimeDrivenActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Activity, Debuggable, Describable, Identifiable, SimulationObject, TimeDrivenActivity, VariableStore, VariableStoreSimulationObject, Prioritizable, java.lang.Comparable<SimulationObject>
public class TimeDrivenActivity
extends Activity
implements TimeDrivenActivity

A task which could be carried out by an element in a specified time. This kind of activities can be characterized by a priority value, presentiality, interruptibility, and a set of workgropus. Each workgroup represents a combination of resource types required for carrying out the activity, and the duration of the activity when performed with this workgroup.

By default, time-driven activities are presential, that is, an element carrying out this activity can't perform simultaneously any other presential activity; and ininterruptible, i.e., once started, the activity keeps its resources until it's finished, even if the resources become unavailable while the activity is being performed. This two characteristics are customizable by means of the Modifier enum type. An activity can be NONPRESENTIAL, when the element can perform other activities while it's performing this one; and INTERRUPTIBLE, when the activity can be interrupted, and later continued, if the resources become unavailable while the activity is being performed. TODO Comment

Author:
Iván Castilla Rodríguez

isNonPresential

public boolean isNonPresential()
Description copied from class: Activity
Returns true if the activity is non presential, i.e., an element can perform other activities at the same time.

Overrides:
isNonPresential in class Activity
Returns:
True if the activity is non presential, false in other case.

isInterruptible

public boolean isInterruptible()
Description copied from class: Activity
Returns true if this activity is interruptible, i.e., the activity is suspended when any of the the resources taken to perform the activity finalize their availability. The activity can be resumed when there are available resources again (but not necessarily the same resources).

By default, an activity is not interruptible.

Overrides:
isInterruptible in class Activity
Returns:
Always false. Subclasses overriding this method must change the default behavior.

mainElementActivity

public boolean mainElementActivity()
An element is valid to perform a time-driven activity is it's not currently carrying out another activity or this activity is non presential.

Specified by:
mainElementActivity in class Activity
Returns:

request

public void request(WorkItem wItem)
Description copied from class: Activity
Requests this activity. Checks if this activity is feasible by the specified work item. If the activity is feasible, Activity.carryOut(WorkItem) is invoked; in other case, the work item is added to this activity's queue.

Specified by:
request in class Activity
Parameters:
wItem - Work Item requesting this activity.
